snippet.textDisplay: @Nintendo  Exactly! Someone else who has the same feeling I do! I liked The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess's dark atmosphere also, and it made it tense and set a great environment, such that you felt you were in Link's shoes, and I felt a similar feeling in The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time. Now, compare both titles to Legend of Zelda: The Skyward Sword. Skyward Sword overall felt much more cartoony with its light and cheery artstyle compared to the environment of Twilight Princess and Ocarina of Time. Skyward Sword looks more animated and I do not at all get the same intense atmosphere as I do from Twilight Princess. This is to the extent that I would have rather bought a Twilight Princess or Ocarina of Time remake (or extension) rather than Skyward Sword. Skyward Sword's gameplay is fun, I am not arguing with that, it is just that because of the art style, I do not at all get the same feeling that I got from Skyward Sword or Ocarina of Time. I hope Nintendo brings back the dark atmosphere in their next Legend of Zelda release. If they do, I will most certainly buy it.
snippet.textOriginal: @Nintendo  Exactly! Someone else who has the same feeling I do! I liked The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess's dark atmosphere also, and it made it tense and set a great environment, such that you felt you were in Link's shoes, and I felt a similar feeling in The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time. Now, compare both titles to Legend of Zelda: The Skyward Sword. Skyward Sword overall felt much more cartoony with its light and cheery artstyle compared to the environment of Twilight Princess and Ocarina of Time. Skyward Sword looks more animated and I do not at all get the same intense atmosphere as I do from Twilight Princess. This is to the extent that I would have rather bought a Twilight Princess or Ocarina of Time remake (or extension) rather than Skyward Sword. Skyward Sword's gameplay is fun, I am not arguing with that, it is just that because of the art style, I do not at all get the same feeling that I got from Skyward Sword or Ocarina of Time. I hope Nintendo brings back the dark atmosphere in their next Legend of Zelda release. If they do, I will most certainly buy it.

snippet.textDisplay: GOD this place creeped me out. I was VERY happy to never come back.
snippet.textOriginal: GOD this place creeped me out. I was VERY happy to never come back.

snippet.textDisplay: The music works for the Twilight Realm in the state it's in when you arrive. Sure, it's a dark, alien, eldritch place, especially compared to the fields of Hyrule, but it's also cursed when you get there thanks to Zant and Ganondorf. Under nicer circumstances, I could see the vast twilit expanses being very peaceful, a great place for meditation and introspection. Perhaps that is what the goddesses intended it for, to have the Interlopers feel the weight of their heresy.
snippet.textOriginal: The music works for the Twilight Realm in the state it's in when you arrive. Sure, it's a dark, alien, eldritch place, especially compared to the fields of Hyrule, but it's also cursed when you get there thanks to Zant and Ganondorf. Under nicer circumstances, I could see the vast twilit expanses being very peaceful, a great place for meditation and introspection. Perhaps that is what the goddesses intended it for, to have the Interlopers feel the weight of their heresy.

snippet.textDisplay: Stats Update: With this Track, Twilight Princess is tied for second-most Zelda tracks alongside Wind Waker and A Link to the Past at 6 a piece.  Ocarina of Time is #1 with 8 tracks.
snippet.textOriginal: Stats Update: With this Track, Twilight Princess is tied for second-most Zelda tracks alongside Wind Waker and A Link to the Past at 6 a piece.  Ocarina of Time is #1 with 8 tracks.

snippet.textDisplay:
To me, all 3D Zelda games have largely similar core gameplay and overall design, but are otherwise very different - with the only possible exception being OOT being similar to TP (which I don't agree with), but their release dates are eight years apart so forget it.

That being said, the hype may have also played a role in TP's perceived disappointment among many Zelda fans.
snippet.textOriginal:
To me, all 3D Zelda games have largely similar core gameplay and overall design, but are otherwise very different - with the only possible exception being OOT being similar to TP (which I don't agree with), but their release dates are eight years apart so forget it.

That being said, the hype may have also played a role in TP's perceived disappointment among many Zelda fans.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh and am I the only one who feels that this series does not deserve to be labelled as stale?  I replayed OOT recently and found it to appeal largely as a game with open-world nature, which of course contrasts from what I felt about TP when I started it right the day after finishing OOT.  Also I feel that TP has a lot of setpieces and dungeon elements which are vastly different from anything in OOT.
snippet.textOriginal: Oh and am I the only one who feels that this series does not deserve to be labelled as stale?  I replayed OOT recently and found it to appeal largely as a game with open-world nature, which of course contrasts from what I felt about TP when I started it right the day after finishing OOT.  Also I feel that TP has a lot of setpieces and dungeon elements which are vastly different from anything in OOT.

snippet.textDisplay: That being said, most of the arguments I've heard for people disliking TP come from it being more of a linear set-piece driven game compared to its predecessors, which sounds pretty much identical to disliking MM because of the three-day system.
snippet.textOriginal: That being said, most of the arguments I've heard for people disliking TP come from it being more of a linear set-piece driven game compared to its predecessors, which sounds pretty much identical to disliking MM because of the three-day system.

snippet.textDisplay:
We're far from TP's launch.  If anything TP's was more popular at back then.

I'm really sad that TP, Brawl, and MGS4 are largely fading from peoples' memories as the years go by.  They really should not.
snippet.textOriginal:
We're far from TP's launch.  If anything TP's was more popular at back then.

I'm really sad that TP, Brawl, and MGS4 are largely fading from peoples' memories as the years go by.  They really should not.

snippet.textDisplay: This was my favorite Zelda game. I played through it twice consecutively, once on GameCube and once on Wii. It was quite strange to play the mirrored version of the Wii where Link is right handed and everything was opposite side. I still loved it. I even got the cannon save glitch and Nintendo sent me a replacement disc.
snippet.textOriginal: This was my favorite Zelda game. I played through it twice consecutively, once on GameCube and once on Wii. It was quite strange to play the mirrored version of the Wii where Link is right handed and everything was opposite side. I still loved it. I even got the cannon save glitch and Nintendo sent me a replacement disc.

snippet.textDisplay: Funny, I was just reflecting on this game recently.  I was thinking about the wolf sections and how much they really broke the mold and how strange they were.  I remember how foreboding and..."backwards" everything felt when I played those sections.  It made me want to fix everything faster so I could be human again.

snippet.textDisplay: An ambient piece perfect for this dungeon. Honestly, I already get very nostalgic listening to tracks like this one. Very unique, there are no other tracks like this one in this list. I absolutely loved this game's dark atmosphere, including the twilight world. I still can't decide which 3D Zelda is my favorite between OoT and this, a bit like how I can't decide which Final Fantasy I prefer between VI and VII. One thing I'm sure of, TP has my favorite dungeons.

I still can't decide which 3D Zelda is my favorite between OoT and this, a bit like how I can't decide which Final Fantasy I prefer between VI and VII. One thing I'm sure of, TP has my favorite dungeons.
